meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of a membrane.
meanings.sent1: The membranal barrier protected the cell from harm.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the membranal structure under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The membranal material was so thin, it felt like touching air.
meanings.sent4: The city was covered in a membranal haze of pollution.
meanings.sent5: The membranal layer shimmered in the sunlight, like a delicate curtain.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to a membrane.
meanings.sent1: The membranal cells formed a protective layer around the organ.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted experiments on the membranal properties of the material.
meanings.sent3: The membranal covering on the book made it waterproof.
meanings.sent4: The fog created a membranal barrier between the two mountains.
meanings.sent5: The membranal lining of the jacket kept the cold wind out.
